chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall a : Z, 1 < a -> ~ prime a -> exists q b : Z, a = Z.mul q b /\ 1 < q /\ 1 < b

Premises:
Inductive prime (p : Z) : Prop := prime_intro : 1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> prime p Arguments prime _%Z_scope Arguments prime_intro _%Z_scope _ _%function_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
not_prime_gen : forall a b : Z, 1 < a -> 1 < b -> b < a -> ~ prime a -> (forall c : Z, b < c < a -> rel_prime c a) -> exists q b0 : Z, a = q * b0 /\ 1 < q /\ 1 < b0
prime_dec_gen : forall a b : Z, 1 < b -> b < a -> (forall c : Z, b < c < a -> rel_prime c a) -> prime a \/ ~ prime a
Z.pow_gt_1 : forall a b : Z, 1 < a -> 0 < b < -> 1 < a ^ b
Zmult_neq_0 : forall a b : Z, a * b <> 0 -> a <> 0 /\ b <> 0
not_prime_divide : forall p : Z, 1 < p -> ~ prime p -> exists n : Z, 1 < n < p /\ (n | p)
Z.pow_lt_mono_l : forall a b c : Z, 0 < c -> 0 <= a < b -> a ^ c < b ^ c
rel_prime_le_prime : forall a p : Z, prime p -> 1 <= a < p -> rel_prime a p
QArith_base.Qlt_shift_div_l : forall a b c : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} c -> QArith_base.Qlt (QArith_base.Qmult a c) b -> QArith_base.Qlt a (QArith_base.Qdiv b c)
QArith_base.Qle_shift_div_l : forall a b c : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} c -> QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qmult a c) b -> QArith_base.Qle a (QArith_base.Qdiv b c)
QArith_base.Qinv_lt_contravar : forall a b : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} a -> QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} b -> QArith_base.Qlt a b < -> QArith_base.Qlt (QArith_base.Qinv b) (QArith_base.Qinv a)
Znumtheory.rel_prime_sym : forall a b : Z, rel_prime a b -> rel_prime b a
rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
Zis_gcd_unique : forall a b c d : Z, Zis_gcd a b c -> Zis_gcd a b d -> c = d \/ c = - d
Zdivide_bounds : forall a b : Z, (a | b) -> b <> 0 -> Z.abs a <= Z.abs b
Gauss : forall a b c : Z, (a | b * c) -> rel_prime a b -> (a | c)
prime_divisors : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a : Z, (a | p) -> a = -1 \/ a = 1 \/ a = p \/ a = - p
Zgcd_is_gcd : forall a b : Z, Zis_gcd a b (Z.gcd a b)
Z.pow_1_l : forall a : Z, 0 <= a -> 1 ^ a = 1
prime' = fun p : Z => 1 < p /\ (forall n : Z, 1 < n < p -> ~ (n | p)) : Z -> Prop Arguments prime' _%Z_scope
prime_mult : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a b : Z, (p | a * b) -> (p | a) \/ (p | b)
R_prime = fun x y : Z => 1 < x /\ 1 < y /\ x < y : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments R_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
prime_dec_aux : forall p m : Z, {forall n : Z, 1 < n < m -> rel_prime n p} + {exists n : Z, 1 < n < m /\ ~ rel_prime n p}
not_rel_prime1 : forall x y : Z, ~ rel_prime x y -> exists d : Z, Zis_gcd x y d /\ d <> 1 /\ d <> -1
Z.gcd_divide_l : forall a b : Z, (Z.gcd a b | a)
Z.gcd_divide_r : forall a b : Z, (Z.gcd a b | b)
Z.gcd_nonneg : forall a b : Z, 0 <= Z.gcd a b
Zdivide_opp_l : forall a b : Z, (a | b) -> (- a | b)
Zdivide_opp_l_rev : forall a b : Z, (- a | b) -> (a | b)
Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : Z, (g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> Zis_gcd a b g
prime_div_prime : forall p q : Z, prime p -> prime q -> (p | q) -> p = q
